gr.phaistosnetworks.TANK

Class ByteManipulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • gr.phaistosnetworks.TANK.ByteManipulator

  • public class ByteManipulator
extends java.lang.Object
    Purpose: To perform magic tricks on bytes. Serializing / deserializing / transforming to and from str8 and varints.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ByteManipulator(byte[] in)
      Constructor that sets the byte array to be manipulated.

      Gets current count of processed bytes.

      • append

        public void append(byte[] in)
        Appends a byte array to the current one.
        Parameters:
        in - the byte array to append.

      • get

        public byte[] get(int length)
        Returns the next length bytes from the current byte array. There is no health check. If you request more bytes than available, boom
        Parameters:
        length - the amount of bytes to return
        Returns:
        a byte array containing the requested length of bytes

      • snappyUncompress

        public byte[] snappyUncompress(long length)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Uncompress the next length bytes using the snappy library.
        Parameters:
        length - the amount of bytes to uncompress
        Returns:
        a byte array containing the uncompressed data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • serialize

        public static byte[] serialize(long data,
                               int length)
        Serializes a long into a byte array with length
        Parameters:
        length - the length of the returned byte array
        data - the long to process.
        Returns:
        a byte array that contains the serialized data.

      • deSerialize

        public long deSerialize(int length)
        Deserializes the next length bytes and returns a long.
        Parameters:
        length - the amount of bytes to deserialize.
        Returns:
        the long value of those bytes.

      • getVarInt

        public long getVarInt()
        reads a varint from the next unprocessed bytes of the current array.
        Returns:
        the long value of the varint

      • getVarInt

        public static byte[] getVarInt(long n)
        transforms a long into a varint byte array. The implementation is based on @mpapadakis varint conversion. It is hard coded up to 5 bytes long, so it can support 32bit unsigned integers. Anything more than that and it will blow up in your face.
        Parameters:
        n - the long to be transformed
        Returns:
        the varint byte array

      • getStr8

        public java.lang.String getStr8()
        returns a String using the str8 notation.
        Returns:
        a string containing the data.

      • getStr8

        public static byte[] getStr8(java.lang.String data)
        returns a byte array in str8 notation of the given String.
        Parameters:
        data - the string to encode into a str8
        Returns:
        a byte array containing the length of the string followed by the data

      • getRemainingLength

        public int getRemainingLength()
        access method to check the remaining unprocessed amount of bytes
        Returns:
        the remaining unprocessed byte count.

      • flushOffset

        public void flushOffset()
        Flushes processed bytes from byte array.

      • getOffset

        public int getOffset()
        Gets current count of processed bytes.
        Returns:
        the count of processed bytes

      • resetOffset

        public void resetOffset()
        Resets current processed byte counter.
